column4: Anybody here work with Samba much?  I just added and set up a new account that can access his home directory, but I can't set up my login (the original) to access his samba share.
k
!ops | thegamez
Question for the active folks in here.  Was that an inappropriate !ops moment?
no, it was ok to call ops, although it was also useless because i got highlighted anyway - but you couldn't have known that
sudo update-rc.d gdm remove
(if you're using GDM, which is the default, as your login manager)
besides haven't you considered using Server given it's, well, a server?
it is the same.
kernel's slightly different
from what I understand, the only difference is the default installed apps and gdm.
also, you get less cruft installed that isn't relevant to a server
do you know how it's different?  NVM, i can go look it up
cruft?
not entirely - it does have the PAE extension enabled, i know that much
GUI apps and such... i didn't mean cruft in a negative sense, just as stuff that a server won't need
sure, -n
thanks.  :)
I don't think he knew fully what I meant by abusing it.
ciao how it's spelled for most latin based European languages.  :) Just FYI
93-47-42-195.ip111.fastwebnet.it is an italian address (my ISP, to be exact), just fyi ;)
now that's doing your homework.
